author: Fiona Simpson
title: Changes to Boots meal deal offer sparks fury among O2 customers
text:
Monday 13 February 2017 17:21 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard Offer expired: O2 have retracted their Boots meal deal offer Sean Dempsey/PA 
Hungry O2 customers have reacted with fury after the provider retracted a popular £1 meal deal offer. 
The offer, available at Boots , allowed customers to enjoy the chain’s meal deal – including a sandwich, a snack and a drink – for just £1. 
However, it was announced on Monday that the O2 priority offer would be scrapped next week. 
Peckish punters will now be forced to fork out the standard £3 for the deal. 
Angry customers took to social media to express their fury at the changes. Just gasped in horror as I realised the £1 Boots meal deal on @O2 ends next week. Got a lot of looks — Megan Holland (@miggysworld) February 13, 2017 
Robyn Roxburgh wrote: “£1 meal deal at Boots on O2 priority ends next week??! NOOO.” A devastating day. They're taking the o2 Boots £1 Monday meal deal away. My thoughts are with those affected at this difficult time. — Lee Rainford (@hisroyalginger) February 13, 2017 
Another user added: “RIP o2 priorities Boots meal deal.” — Adam Carter (@AdamlCarter) February 13, 2017 
Adam said: “Only one more week of O2 / Boots meal deal Hmmm... I wonder what Poundland has to offer!? #O2Priority” 
The £1 deal ends on February 20, the Mirror reported . Read more Sainsbury's sparks fury among customers with changes to £3 meal deal 
An O2 spokeswoman told the paper: “We constantly review all the deals available on Priority which gives our customers access to some great offers that help them to save money. 
“Customers can still enjoy access to other £1 lunch offers on Mondays by checking out the latest deals through the Priority app (subject to availability).” More about:
